alert.note: Alert for Cuyahoga; Geauga; Lake; Summit (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 4:17AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Geauga, Cuyahoga, southwestern Lake and northeastern Summit Counties through 500 AM EDT... At 417 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Parma, or near Cleveland, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cleveland, Willowick, Parma, Lakewood, Euclid, Mentor, Cleveland Heights, Strongsville, North Royalton, Solon, Willoughby, Twinsburg, Eastlake, Warrensville Heights, Macedonia, South Russell, Highland Hills, Timberlake, Lakeline and Chesterland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM EDT for northeastern Ohio.
